title: 112_hr3012
content: The Act titled "Fairness for High-Skilled Immigrants Act of 2011" imposes a numerical limitation on visas from any single foreign state. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to adjust visa numerical limitations and make conforming amendments. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to adjust visa numerical limitations and make conforming amendments, including special rules for countries at ceiling and a country-specific offset under the Chinese Student Protection Act of 1992. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to adjust visa numerical limitations and make conforming amendments, including special rules for countries at ceiling and a country-specific offset under the Chinese Student Protection Act of 1992. The amendments include changes to the allocation of immigrant visas for employment-based immigrants starting from fiscal year 2012. For fiscal years 2012, 2013, and 2014, a percentage of immigrant visas under specific sections of the Immigration and Nationality Act will be allotted to natives of foreign states not among the top two states with the highest numbers of immigrants in previous years. For fiscal year 2014, 10 percent of immigrant visas under specific sections of the Immigration and Nationality Act will be reserved for natives of foreign states not among the top two states with the highest numbers of immigrants in fiscal year 2012. Each foreign state or dependent area may not receive more than 25 percent of the reserved visas. In fiscal years 2012, 2013, and 2014, immigrant visas are allocated based on specific percentages for natives of foreign states. Additionally, a special rule is in place to prevent unused visas in these years. In fiscal years 2012, 2013, and 2014, immigrant visas are allocated based on specific percentages for natives of foreign states. A special rule is in place to prevent unused visas in these years, with rules for chargeability to determine the foreign state an alien is chargeable to. Passed the House of Representatives on November 29, 2011. Attest: KAREN L. HAAS, Clerk.
